title: Impact of corporate earnings reports on Roku Inc stock's price movements

content.text: Roku Inc released its Q3 2021 earnings report on November 3, 2021. The report exceeded market expectations, with the company reporting strong revenue growth and beating analysts' estimates for both revenue and earnings per share. As a result, the stock price of Roku Inc surged by 20% in after-hours trading following the release of the earnings report.

On February 18, 2021, Roku Inc published its Q4 2020 earnings report. The report revealed impressive quarterly results, with record revenue, active accounts, and streaming hours. Despite these positive figures, the stock price reacted by dropping more than 6% in after-hours trading. While the earnings report highlighted strong performance, investors may have had higher expectations, leading to a sell-off.

Roku Inc announced its Q2 2021 earnings report on August 4, 2021. The report presented solid financials, including robust revenue growth and increased streaming hours. Nevertheless, the stock price experienced a decline of approximately 5% shortly after the earnings report's release. This reaction might be attributed to profit-taking by some investors who had already enjoyed significant gains or concerns over the company's future growth potential.

news.headline: Why Roku Stock Blasted Nearly 9% Higher on Friday
news.summary: A pair of analyst price-target increases capped a winning week for the shares of Roku (NASDAQ: ROKU) on Friday when the streaming video platform gained 9% in reaction to those moves.  The two prognosticators behind the Roku raises were Truist Securities' Matthew Thornton and Citigroup's Jason Bazinet.  Thornton upped his price target to $75 per share from $70, and Bazinet added $2 to his for a new level of $80.

news.headline: Roku's Stock Leaps After Revenue Beat, Upbeat Sales Guidance
news.summary: Roku shares jumped Thursday after the digital video company turned in a fourth-quarter revenue outlook that was stronger than Wall Street expected.  Roku said it expected fourth-quarter revenue of about $955 million, a little higher than the $952 million analysts' average on FactSet.

news.headline: Why Roku (ROKU) Stock Is Up Today
news.summary: Shares of streaming TV platform Roku (NASDAQ: ROKU) jumped 15.6% in the morning session after the company reported third quarter results that exceeded analysts' revenue expectations, driven in part by better active account growth. While revenue guidance for Q4 was in line, adjusted EBITDA guidance was well ahead, and that was probably the most exciting aspect of this earnings report. Overall, this quarter's results seemed fairly positive, and shareholders should feel optimistic.

news.headline: Here's Why Roku Stock Skyrocketed Today
news.summary: Shares of connected-TV platform company Roku (NASDAQ: ROKU) skyrocketed on Thursday after the company reported financial results for the third quarter of 2023.  Roku saw a recovery in video advertisements and its revenue growth rate consequently reaccelerated.  Prior to today's jump, Roku stock was trading near five-year lows because its revenue growth had slowed and its expenses had soared.

news.headline: Roku Inc (ROKU) Reports 20% YoY Growth in Total Net Revenue in Q3 2023
news.summary: Streaming giant surpasses 100 billion streaming hours on a trailing 12-month basis for the first time

news.headline: Roku: We've Seen a "Solid Rebound in Video Ads"
news.summary: 2023 has been a year of recovery for streaming TV platform company Roku (NASDAQ: ROKU).  "We had a solid rebound in video ads in Q3 and we expect the YoY growth rate of video ads in Q4 to be similar," Roku told investors in its third-quarter shareholder letter.  Roku's upbeat view for Q4 is encouraging news after Meta Platforms spooked investors late last month as it downplayed its own acceleration with warnings about an uncertain macroeconomic environment's potentially negative impact on ad spend going forward.

news.headline: Roku stock soars on Q3 revenue beat
news.summary: Smart TV creator Roku, Inc. (ROKU) sees its stock jump in after-hours trading on Wednesday after posting a third-quarter revenue beat, reporting $912 million against estimates of $859.9 million. Yahoo Finance’s Alexandra Canal, Pras Subramanian, and Josh Schafer review Roku’s earnings in the grand scheme of the TV and media content landscapes. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live.

news.headline: Roku (NASDAQ:ROKU) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q3, Stock Soars
news.summary: Streaming TV platform Roku (NASDAQ: ROKU) beat analysts' expectations in Q3 FY2023, with revenue up 19.8% year on year to $912 million. The company also expects next quarter's revenue to be around $955 million, in line with analysts' estimates. Turning to EPS, Roku made a GAAP loss of $2.33 per share, down from its loss of $0.88 per share in the same quarter last year.

news.headline: 5 Top Stocks for November
news.summary: One way to position yourself for financial success is to invest in quality companies that have what it takes to endure a downturn in the economic cycle and, preferably, take market share when their peers are unable to do so.  United Parcel Service (NYSE: UPS), Brookfield Infrastructure Partners (NYSE: BIPC)(NYSE: BIP), Roku (NASDAQ: ROKU), Mastercard (NYSE: MA), and TransMedics Group (NASDAQ: TMDX) stand out as five stocks investors may want to add to their wish list this holiday season.  UPS and Brookfield Infrastructure blend value and passive income, while Roku, Mastercard, and TransMedics are excellent growth candidates.

news.headline: 3 Reasons Roku Stock Looks Like a No-Brainer Buy
news.summary: After dropping 82% in 2022, Roku (NASDAQ: ROKU) shares have outperformed the market this year, rising some 50% through late October.  Leading streaming service Netflix reported strong subscriber numbers for the three-month period that ended June 30.  Investors likely hope that Roku will also impress Wall Street when it announces its third-quarter financials on Nov. 1.
